【促請美國國會立即展開《香港人權與民主法案》立法程序】

近日美國國會轄下「美中經濟與安全審核委員會」發表年度報告，指中共政權持續損害香港政治制度、法治以及言論自由，令香港逐漸與中國城市無異，建議國會要求美國商務部重新審視將香港及中國視為兩個獨立關稅地區。

可見美國國會已注意到香港在港共殖民政府持續受到中共政權傀儡操作實行高壓統治，逐漸失去一國兩制賦予香港的應有權利。

有見及此，學生動源促請美國國會立即展開《香港人權與民主法案》的立法程序以保障香港人權與民主避免進一步受到中共政權剝削，對損害香港政治制度、民主自由及言論自由的香港和中國的官員實施制裁，凍結其在美國的所有資產並且禁止入境，與此同時保障所有因示威活動被捕甚至入獄[url]受到政治檢控的香港人不會被拒發美國簽證[/url]。

稍後學生動源將會致函予美國國務院並到美國駐港領事館提交有關請願信。

學生動源
二零一八年十一月十六日

Pleading United States Congress launch the legislative process of Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act Immediately

Recently, the US-China Economic and Security Review Commission (USCC) of the US Congress published an annual report, stating that the Chinese Communist Government continuously damaging Hong Kong’s political system, rule of law and freedom of speech, causing Hong Kong gradually becoming a city no difference with a Chinese city. Thus, suggesting the US Department of Commerce to re-consider regarding China and Hong Kong as two separate customs areas.

From what the report suggests, the US Congress had noticed the Colonial Communist Government of Hong Kong has been repeatedly compressed by the Chinese Communist Government to achieve its coercion, progressively losing the rights given to Hong Kong by the “One Country, Two Systems” principle.

In spite of this, Studentlocalism urges the US Congress to carry out the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act’s legislation procedure immediately, in order to avoid Hong Kong’s human rights and democracy to be exploited by the CCP government in the future. Additionally, we suggest the US Government to sanction those Chinese and Hong Kong officials who damage Hong Kong’s political system, rule of law and freedom of speech by freezing all of his/her properties in the United States and forbidding him/her from immigrating the United States, and on the same time safeguarding all HongKongers who are being charged or sentenced for demonstration activities by not refusing their applications for US visa.

Later, Studentlocalism will write a letter of petition to the Congress of the United States and submit to the Consulate General of the United States, Hong Kong.

Studentlocalism
November 16, 2018
